issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
The POM dependency on okhttp in hadoop-hdfs-client declares its version in that POM instead.

the root declaration, including version, must go into the hadoop-project/pom.xml so that its easy to track use and have only one place if this version were ever to be incremented. As it stands, if any other module picked up the library, they could adopt a different version.
fields.summary: move declaration of okhttp version from hdfs-client to hadoop-project POM

comments.body: I posted the v0 patch to move okhttp version to hadoop-project/pom.xml.

This message was automatically generated.

You don't need to declare the okhttp version in hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs-client/pom.xml (just leave out the version field). Also since okhttp.version is used in just one place you can eliminate the variable and use the version string directly in the hadoop-project/pom.xml dependency section.
Don't know what happened to previous build. I posted v1 patch to trigger new build.
